author: cbs8
title: IN: Intruder stopped with medieval fighting skills, samurai swor
text:
INDIANAPOLIS, IN (WXIN/CNN) - An Indianapolis woman fought off a home intruder using some serious fighting skills and a samurai sword.
“I could see the guy standing about here, and I just came out of the bathroom and started punching - ‘get out, get out, get out,’” said Karen Dolley, who woke up and found an intruder standing the hallway of her home Friday morning.
She knew she had to do whatever it took to protect herself.
“If I feel threatened as I’m coming awake, I’m going to attack,” Dolley said.
It only took a few seconds for the suspect to force open her door and get inside.
The 43-year-old Dolley - who is trained in Medieval combat - jumped out of bed, flicked on the lights and punched the man in the face at least 10 times.
Then, she grabbed her large Japanese combat sword.
“It’s got an edge,” she said of the sword. “It will cut.”
She held the blade of the sword to the intruder until police arrived.
“I just held it on him like this while he was on the floor, and I’m calling 911 with the other hand,” Dolley said.
Officers arrested 30-year-old Jacob Wessel of Greenwood.
“He was so out of it,” Dolley said of the intruder.
Police say Wessel was high on an unknown substance when he broke in. He repeatedly told officers he was hiding from someone - but he had no idea his hiding place would have a woman with a Japanese sword.
“I would have swung or I would have stabbed,” Dolley said of the fight that could have erupted.
But Wessel didn’t put up a fight, and he apologized on the way out.
“If he would have behaved in a slightly different manner he would not have gotten out of here alive,” she said.
